Method: Needs assessments, stakeholder survey, investigate number of, size, publishing location of datasets, investigate existing grant funded projects and grants

TOPIC: E.2 Data Governance—Legal and Regulatory Compliance
Outcomes (see comment): Data governance legal policies, framework, and plans exist and are continually updated

TOPIC: The policies, procedures, and processes to manage and monitor an organization’s regulatory [and] legal responsibilities and risks pertaining to data.
Outcomes (see comment): Research is conducted ethically

Activity: Conduct a dataset inventory
Outcomes (see comment): Dataset inventory exists and includes relevant dataset metadata including: repository, identifiers, data usage metrics, creators, funders, supporting grants
Milestone Indicator (Outputs): Dataset inventory

Activity: Conduct a data services inventory
Outcomes (see comment): Data services inventory: includes relevant data services provided across institution or unit
Milestone Indicator (Outputs): Data Services inventory

Activity: Conduct a risk assessment
Outcomes (see comment): Risk is assessed and includes risks associated with unmanaged data, research subject privacy, data preservation, funder compliance

Participants: CISO, CIO, Chief Officer for Risk and Compliance
Method: Many Risk Assessment tools and framework (NISTIR 8062)

Activity: Implement solutions to mitigate and manage risk discovered in risk assessment
Outcomes (see comment): Risks determined in risk assessment are mitigated, managed, and controlled
Milestone Indicator (Outputs): Risk mitigation plan, Data Governance plans
Participants: CISO, CIO, Chief Officer for Risk and Compliance

Outcomes (see comment): Policies for sharing and licensing data exist

Outcomes (see comment): Data shared, used, or reused is regulated as appropriate

TOPIC: Definitions of who has access to what data and based on what criteria

SUBTOPIC: SUR.7.3 Protection of limited data/secure platforms/enclaves
SUR.7.4 Constraints and restrictions on data use and sharing

TOPIC: SUR.8 Architectures for Application, Use, and Reuse
SUBTOPIC: SUR.8.1 Extensibility across communities, including machine-based interactions

TOPIC: PD.1 Criteria for Preservation
Outcomes (see comment): Research data is selected for curation and preservation considering factors of use, impact, value, uniqueness, cost, provenance, and legal requirements
Guiding documents: ["How to Appraise and Select Research Data for Curation" | https://www.dcc.ac.uk/guidance/how-guides/appraise-select-data]

TOPIC: Quantitative and qualitative metrics used to assess the need for long-term retention of data.
PD.2 Sustainability
Outcomes (see comment): Preservation method for appropriate datasets is sustainable and funded
Guiding documents: ["Library of Congress Sustainability of Digital Formats" | https://www.loc.gov/preservation/digital/formats/content/dataset.shtml]

TOPIC: Longevity of the data infrastructure and data management systems
PD.3 Storage and Preservation
SUBTOPIC: PD.3.1 Media to store and preserve data
Outcomes (see comment): Storage and preservation method for appropriate datasets is appropriate

TOPIC: How data are stored, backed-up, and preserved

SUBTOPIC: PD.3.3 Ability to do advanced searches

TOPIC: PD.4 Moving Data from One Service to Another across Organizations
Outcomes (see comment): Roles and responsibilities for data when transfering between locations are assigned

TOPIC: PD.5 Retention and Disposition Schedules
SUBTOPIC: PD.5.1 Technical decisions, e.g., data archiving
Outcomes (see comment): Retention period for data is assigned at time of publication and appropriate (10 years, permanent, etc.)

TOPIC: A plan of action that indicates the period of time to retain records
Outcomes (see comment): Retention and disposition schedules assign retention periods for datasets and policies to apply retention periods exist and are enforced
Data that has past it's retention period can be removed from repository. Assign retention period before publication
Archival data is preserved following archival guidelines and retention schedules.

SUBTOPIC: PD.5.6 Recognition of removed data, i.e., tombstone page
Outcomes (see comment): Data removed from a repository is indicated through metadata
